related.meaning: to pass on (a message, thoughts, etc.)
gathering material (for an article, novel, etc.)

lessons.japanese: 一度失えば、決して取り戻すことはできないだろう。
lessons.english: Once gone, you will never get it back.

lessons.japanese: できるだけ勉強して、浪費した時間を取り戻すつもりです。
lessons.english: I will make up for the lost time by working as hard as I can.

lessons.japanese: いったん失ったものは取り戻すことはできない。
lessons.english: You cannot take back what you have once lost.

lessons.japanese: 彼はその計画の遅れを取り戻すための意見を提出した。
lessons.english: He put forward a plan for improving the rate of production.

lessons.japanese: 長い休暇で彼は健康を取り戻すだろう。
lessons.english: The long vacation will give him back his health.

lessons.japanese: 遅れを取り戻す事ができればよいのに。
lessons.english: I wish I could make up for lost time.

lessons.japanese: 遅れを取り戻すのは無理だと思うんです。
lessons.english: I'm afraid we can't make up for lost ground.

lessons.japanese: 遅れを取り戻すのは無理だと思うんです。
lessons.english: I think it isn't possible for us to make up for lost time.

lessons.japanese: 遅れを取り戻すのは無理だと思うんです。
lessons.english: I'm afraid that we can't make up for lost ground.

lessons.japanese: 戦闘後、平和維持軍が平穏を取り戻すために活動しました。
lessons.english: Peace-keeping troops moved in to restore calm after the battle.

lessons.japanese: 失った時間を取り戻すために、私たちはいそいだ。
lessons.english: We hurried to make up for the lost time.
